attributes.action: Instigate UK Referendum on whether to complete HS/2.
attributes.background: Instigate UK Referendum on whether to complete HS/2. A UK peoples' vote is required. The likely 100B GBP could be spent on other local transportation requirements which offer a better ROI, and solve real transportation issues.

attributes.action: Combat ‘fake news’ by introducing critical thinking to citizenship studies.
attributes.background: Politics and the media affect every citizen in the United Kingdom. However, the link between the two is poorly taught. Critical analysis of media sources is not a core component of citizenship studies. For our students to mature into well-informed voters, these critical skills must be introduced.
attributes.additional_details: I propose that critical thinking be introduced to the KS 3-4 citizenship curriculum. In addition to understanding the UK’s political structure, it is crucial for students to be educated about the validity of media sources and media bias. These skills will become increasingly important in a digital world. In particular, these skills would help combat the destructive phenomenon of ‘fake news’. As such, critical analysis should be a compulsory component of the core curriculum.

attributes.action: Make income tax a standard 20%, regardless of how much you earn.
attributes.background: As it is now the more you earn the more tax you pay so if you're lucky enough to be earning £40k a year the government take about 5k in income tax, 5k in national insurance not even including student loans and pension contributions. The amount you take home does not reflect the work you do.

attributes.action: To make selling alcohol after 10:00 PM illegal.
attributes.background: This will be helpful because then there would be less drunk people around midnight and people that would be travelling would feel safer.

attributes.action: Declare a Climate Emergency, end fossil fuel use and build community resilience.
attributes.background: The current wave of extreme weather around the globe and in Britain indicates that the climate emergency predicted by our scientists is now here. We must prepare for community resilience in the face of climate impacts and take urgent steps to limit warming and reverse temperatures to 1980s levels.

attributes.action: Put a limit on the amount of homework students can be given in a week.
attributes.background: The reason to this is that the amount of homework given to students at the moment is reducing time that could be spent on something productive such as clubs. Also a lot of people spend more time on homework than they would outside in their own time.

attributes.action: Give Northern Ireland a vote on whether to accept the backstop
attributes.background: Leaving the EU is a change in constitutional status, and the people of Northern Ireland are being denied their rights to vote on whether they support that change for themselves or whether they vote for their own specific backstop.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/the-belfast-agreement

attributes.action: Provide Sirius minerals with full Loan Guarantee from HM treasury.
attributes.background: Sirius minerals is currently building a multi billion pound fertilizer mine in Yorkshire which will boost exports and create thousands of jobs locally and nationally.  the government as of today will not fully support this project with loan guarantees.
attributes.additional_details: The government will not take a stand and guarantee the jobs for thousands of UK workers in the form of a FULL loan guarantee, all the time companies are currently making redundancies, Jaguar Land rover for instance currently set to make 4000 plus redundant. Get your priorities straight, stop squabbling about Brexit which is eroding this country and fund this project, your country needs it.

attributes.action: Lowering the voting age in referendums to 16
attributes.background: As some feel teenagers aren’t mature enough to vote in general elections, I feel as referendums such as Brexit ultimately affect the lives of young people, we should be allowed to have a say, as it defines our future.

attributes.action: An extra £1 taken from every tax payer to go directly toward local NHS services.
attributes.background: Many people are concerned by privatisation of NHS services. As a preventative measure, each tax paying adult is to give an extra £1 per month from their main source of income, which will go directly towards funding local NHS services.

attributes.action: Make the running of a stationary car in any car park, public or private illegal.
attributes.background: It is currently illegal to sit in your car whilst keeping the engine running on a public road. This law needs to be extended to any car park, public or private or on a private drive in order to protect children and the environment from harmful emissions.
attributes.additional_details: For example, people leaving their engines running in school car parks may be exposing children to harmful emissions. Whilst schools may be proactive in trying to get people to stop these behaviours to protect children from harmful emissions, the law currently only states that it is illegal to run your engine on a public road. I want the law extended to both private and public car parks.

attributes.action: Change law so a caring original owner can reclaim their dog
attributes.background: I was made homeless 4 years ago and was placed in bed and breakfast so I couldn’t take my dog with me. We had him two years from a puppy. So I found a friend who was willing to look after him till I got my home. I was paying for my boys expenses and food only for him to sell him.
attributes.additional_details: The police told me that he was looked after and being fed there’s nothing I could do. Last week I saw a video of my boy at the local kennels immediately made contact. I told them I’m going to do whatever it take to bring him home, They let me go see him. They told me yes he’s my dog he’s in my name still. But he’s been there over 7 days so he’s no longer mine. He’s not allowed home and he’s got a new family. The law should allow people like me to reclaim their pets.

attributes.action: The UK to apply to join the Schengen Agreement
attributes.background: The Schengen Agreement guarantees border check-free travel for people within its member states. The UK should apply to join Schengen immediately to avoid travel disruption after Brexit. It's not necessary to be in the EU or EEA to join. Switzerland isn't a member of either, but is in Schengen.
attributes.additional_details: If the UK joins Schengen, there will be no more passport checks at Dover or Calais. People will be able to enter and leave the UK without any checks. This could hugely benefit the UK economy in terms of trade, open migration and tourism. It will also help the UK to develop a more humane policy towards asylum-seekers and refugees. If the UK joins Schengen, no-one will need to risk their life trying to cross the Channel by dinghy anymore.

attributes.action: Give leave to remain to Commonwealth Citizens and HM Forces service personnel
attributes.background: Give all commonwealth citizens and HM Forces service personnel the indefinite right to live in the UK. We owe an allegiance to the United Kingdom and Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth the Second regardless of our nationality.
attributes.additional_details: Regular or Reserve, Serving or Ex-Service personnel should be protected, especially citizens of the Commonwealth serving in HM Forces. Parliament should pass a law that protect all service members of all branches of the British Forces, regular and reserve. We're not just a number.

attributes.action: Change minimum legal age of marriage in England and Wales to 18
attributes.background:
It's actually so ridiculous that 16 year olds can get married at age 16 with parental permission. 
Just don't think it's right.
attributes.additional_details: What did you do when you were 16 that you regret? Hopefully nothing that legally bound you!

attributes.action: International marriage legal right to be with family wives husbands and children
attributes.background: Even people who’ve been married for years can have to wait months or even years for a settlement visa. The Home Office never gets back to you and can keep you on hold for months or years at a time.
attributes.additional_details: There should be an automatic legal right for the partners and children of British citizens to live with them in the UK, without the ridiculous prices of visas, travel costs and time spent waiting for an outcome.

attributes.action: Change the law for mothers who separate and are not married
attributes.background: The law should be changed so that women who separate from a long term relationship have the right to a fair settlement of their finances and living arrangements. It’s not right that someone can be in a relationship for 15 years, have children together and have no rights.

attributes.action: Reduce the number of days in a year a workers union can strike to 12 days a year
attributes.background: Over the last 12 months union strikes have disrupted public transport. At the moment operators like Northern have been striking every Saturday since October 2018. I would like to  introduce a cap of 12 days a year for unions to use for there strike days.

attributes.action: Urge India and Pakistan to create an independent state in Kashmir
attributes.background: Urge India and Pakistan to create an independent state in Indian-Occupied Kashmir. Anti-India protests and clashes erupted in Indian-occupied Kashmir on Saturday after a gun battle between militants and government forces killed rebels, police and residents.
attributes.additional_details: India and Pakistan each claim the divided territory of Kashmir in its entirety. Rebels have been fighting Indian control since 1989. Many Kashmiris support the rebel cause that the territory be united either under Pakistani rule or as an independent country. India accuses Pakistan of arming and training the rebels, a charge Pakistan denies. Nearly 70,000 people have been killed in the uprising and the ensuing Indian military crackdown.

attributes.action: Parliamentary Code of Conduct for Members of Parliament to be amended.
attributes.background: No MP, their immediate family partners or spouses may hold any offshore account exempt from UK Income Tax in order to ensure integrity in Office.
attributes.additional_details:
The Armed Forces of the United Kingdom abide by the Codes of Conduct that are integral to the maintenance and the upholding of the highest moral standards so as to be beyond reproach in their actions.  It is proposed that transparency, honesty, courage and discipline be returned to the Houses of Parliament.  
https://www.army.mod.uk/media/5219/20180910-values_standards_2018_final.pdf

attributes.action: Move the British embassy in Israel to Jerusalem
attributes.background: Israel like every country is allowed to make the choice of where its capital is. Israel has chosen its capital as Jerusalem. Therefore the embassy should be in Jerusalem, as most embassies are in countries’ capitals.

attributes.action: Ban Drones
attributes.background: Drones are not safe for private citizens to handle. Drones are a government device and should not be in the use of civilian and private hands. This is similar to the issue of guns and semi-automatic weapons; they just don't belong in the hands of private citizens.
attributes.additional_details: Drones are like small airplanes that are not manned. Why would anyone without a pilot's license even be allowed to have one? I believe these planes in the wrong hands could do a lot of damage. They have the potential for so much harm when used for the wrong reasons. They infringe on peoples privacy, not to mention the danger of accidents involving drones.

attributes.action: Publish Northern Ireland (no border) planning papers in a no-deal Brexit
attributes.background: The government has published numerious technical notices for a no-deal Brexit outcome. Information provided covers a wide range of topics, from pet travel requirements to pharmaceuticals. Since EU can't stop the UK from a no-deal Brexit, what are the governments unilateral contingency plans for N.I.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/how-to-prepare-if-the-uk-leaves-the-eu-with-no-deal#overview

attributes.action: Hold a General Election in April 2019.
attributes.background: The UK populace deserves to have a people’s vote, on which UK Party, will lead us into the future. After we leave the European Union. Give people a choice on what party will take over after 29th March 2019.
attributes.additional_details: I feel that the Conservative Party, should allow this. As they have made a bit of a catastrophe out of this whole Brexit ordeal. They owe us that much. Please allow an April 2019 - UK General Election.

attributes.action: Change smoking warnings to include the benefits of stopping smoking
attributes.background: Smoking warnings are scare stories that may impact people but they are all one sided and only convey the negative aspects of smoking. Why not include the positive aspects of stopping smoking. Short texts documenting the benefits along with the negative could work better than the usual scare stories.
attributes.additional_details:
On the NHS website the first lines on the what happens when you stop smoking page are - Stopping smoking can make a drastic improvement to your lifestyle and health in ways you might not expect. 
And 
Once you stop smoking, some of the benefits are immediate and some are longer-term.
They then include personal stories of people who quit smoking. The question is which approach works better? The warnings or the benefits? Or even a mix of both? It seems that the one sided approach is naive at best.

attributes.action: Parliament to allow the electorate to have a yes or no referendum on referendums
attributes.background: We the public are being constantly told we must have another referendum for different issues. Do we as a country want to have them in our constitution, do we have a vote on the same issue every 2 or 5 years like some want on the EU issue.
attributes.additional_details:
Some requests for referendums on the petition website: 
Hold a referendum on the final Brexit deal 
Stop possible second referendum on E.U. membership 
Hold a referendum for the legalisation of cannabis 
In 2019 hold a referendum to reinstate capital punishment 
All UK citizens have the right to vote on referendums affecting the UK's future. 
Hold a referendum on Proportional Representation for parliamentary elections

attributes.action: I’m asking for mindfulness and self love taught compulsory in schools.
attributes.background: The mental health and crime rates are at a controllable level if you actively put in place the right solution. Mindfulness meditation and self love and appreciation of others should be taught compulsory in schools as this could mean the difference for our next generation. This can only be positive.
attributes.additional_details: We are moving in to a time where children are struggling with self love, love of others and the ability to handle emotions, not being able to handle emotions results in dissociating with them, this is why most children and adult are currently suffering. We need to teach children how to love one another for internal attributes and ensure meditation in the morning so they are ready for their day. Children work harder than we think and deserve the right care, they rest their bodies what about minds

attributes.action: Require schools to buy text books made from recycled materials.
attributes.background: In school, we have been looking at deforestation and the causes and impacts of it. As an individual I have realized that a major issue for deforestation is the need for paper and other school supplies. Instead of cutting down more trees we should use recycled materials to help the environment!
attributes.additional_details: Each year, globally, we are losing 18.7 million acres of forests. Due to this we are left with only 3000 wild tigers across the world. It has been shown that the amazon rain-forest has lost 17% of its trees in the past 50 years, due to forest conversion. In addition, it is shown that trees are our carbon sinks, therefore proving that they inhale the carbon we cant. If they cant inhale this carbon it will be let off into the atmosphere. 15% of all greenhouse gases are due to deforestation.

attributes.action: Remove free bus travel from under 16s
attributes.background: Child obesity is big concern in this day & age. By removing free travel, more children would walk to school instead of jumping on bus for just one or two stops!
attributes.additional_details: Removal of children's free travel will not only help obesity, but also cut congestion on buses, where people going to work & the elderly could get a seat

attributes.action: Abolish University Tuition Fees
attributes.background: On average tuition fees cost up to £9,250 a year. People CANT AFFORD this!

attributes.action: Make standard code of practice for safety in soft play & indoor play mandatory
attributes.background: As a parent of 3 children,I know just how popular soft play centres can be for families. With UK weather, they are often needed as fair weather place for children to play. Just as the amount of centres in the UK increase, so do the amount of incidents including harm to children. Regulation is needed
attributes.additional_details:
There are many cases that have been reported in the news of incidents at soft play, which include:
Accidents:
https://www.netmums.com/coffeehouse/being-mum-794/children-4-11-years-60/759544-soft-play-centres-accidents.html
Bullying & Harm:
https://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/whats-on/family-kids/mum-bullied-abused-playcentre-having-2029547
Food Hygeine
https://www.gazettelive.co.uk/news/teesside-news/investigation-play-factory-vomiting-outbreak-14443979

attributes.action: Require weekly nature protection classes in schools
attributes.background: I graduated the theoretical high school Stefan Banulescu in Romania. The high school at that time  owned the GREEN FLAG provided by the European Inspectors who mattered with that high school.
attributes.additional_details: I would like environmental protection classes aim at cleaning parks, gardening, proper care of plants and animals. Excursions to the zoo, proximity to the natural environment that is existential to be saved, and many other innovative things that can be brought into discussion in some projects.

attributes.action: Fireworks should only be sold in registered gun shops
attributes.background:
Restrict the sale of fireworks to just registered gun dealers. Gun dealers are competent and qualified in firearms and ammunition so are certainly the right people for judging whom they sell too.
 This will prevent fireworks from falling into the hands of youths and the wrong people.

attributes.action: Ban all chewing gum except therapeutic, dental or nicotine chewing gum.
attributes.background: Chewing gum is pointless. Everywhere you look. There are small white blobs on the pavement - in schools, towns, in public transport, under tables and chairs and even in supermarkets making Britian's town's and cities a unsightly place to live.
attributes.additional_details:
The annual clean-up bill on the UK’s streets has been estimated at £150m. Some councils spend £200,000 a year cleaning up gum from pavements with high-powered hoses. Cash-strapped council's could use this money better elsewhere like Housing, transport, education, police funding AND THE NHS.
On average it costs £1.00 for an average pack of chewing gum, but it costs £1.50 to remove a single piece of dropped gum. This is a waste of tax payers money!
It also causes a nuisance in schools.

attributes.action: Make domestic abuse punishments more severe.
attributes.background: 1 in 5 children in the UK have witnessed domestic abuse, this can psychologically torment and haunt these young, innocent, minds. With more support from the government we could make the punishment more severe to make people thing twice before they partake in this disgusting crime.
attributes.additional_details:
Only 46% of domestic abuse crimes ended in arrests in 2007 which deters others from reporting the abuse.
70% of all domestic abuse stories are female.
On average an individual will have been abused 35 times before reporting.
Domestic abuse costs the public £23 billion each year.

attributes.action: Let people 17 and over get tattoos with parental consent
attributes.background: This petition is to let people get tattoos at the age of 17 with parental consent. Some people get tattoos when drunk. This would not be the case if it was made so that 17 year olds needed parental consent. They wouldn't be drunk with their parents so I think it would be perfectly reasonable.

attributes.action: Make CCTV mandatory on streets where crime doubles in 6 months.
attributes.background: Hotspots of escalating crime figures are indications of organised crime where false reporting and framing of individuals for crimes they didnt commit can become more likely. CCTV is advisable on streets where crime figures double in 6 months
attributes.additional_details: Sign the petition and change the law so CCTV stops gangs lying to the police

attributes.action: Reduce the amount of homework received by primary school students.
attributes.background: Being a student myself, I know the struggle. Children in primary education receive an unnecessary amount of homework each week, and need to be enjoying their childhood, and being more active. The only important homework is reading and spellings.
attributes.additional_details: Some of the homework they receive is sometimes difficult to understand, and not always relevant to their learning. Not only do the students feel pressurised at such a young age, but it can also cause conflict at home between the student and their parents. This is due to the parents also feeling stressed.

attributes.action: Ensure school curriculum includes educating students on crime and consequences
attributes.background: Crime at young ages affects everyone in the community. It affects the offender as they should be learning and that is postponed or permanently stopped. It would affect the victim as it would affect any victim mentally. It will also affect the community as a whole, making the area look atrocious.

attributes.action: Up grade the A34 to motorway standard.
attributes.background: The A34 is a major road linking motorways, it regularly suffers from road closures due to accidents. These affect the economy and cause major problems on surrounding roads as there is no suitable alternative route.  It has been stated by numerous people that the A34 is no longer fit for purpose.

attributes.action: Make both GCSE English papers optional
attributes.background: I want to the government to remove English from the compulsory or “core” subjects. This is due to the fact that analysis of poems and a 400 year old play will never benefit most people in the working world. In the modern world STEM subjects are much more important and English is irrelevant.

attributes.action: all children to attend the school nearest to their home address
attributes.background: Remove parental choice of school - You only have to travel in commuter time in school holidays vs other dates to know how much congestion and pollution,and  along with wasted man hours and traffic collisions are caused by children having to commute to their parents' chosen schools.
attributes.additional_details:
What a waste of time and valuable growing up, as well as the safety risks.

Parents would be better off spending their time energy and money on helping to improve their local school rather than selfishly encouraging their children to attend 'better' ones further away.

attributes.action: Create a governing body to regulate private landlords to protect tenants
attributes.background: Too many private landlords do not carry out their legal obligations at the detriment of their tenants. A governing body is required to regulate such requirements and support tenants whom need to report such landlords for not meeting safety & obligatory maintenance and to investigate harrassment
attributes.additional_details: If you have been subjected to unsafe living conditions, patronising responses, lack of communication and no action taken on much needed property repairs and/or maintenance, then a regulating body is required to fully investigate in depth. Local authorities currently do not have enough capacity to assist with such needs across the UK.

attributes.action: Lower the NHS charges at dentists
attributes.background: The NHS charges at dentists are becoming more akin to private treatment and beyond the budget of ordinary people. The result is that people suffer poor dental health because they can't afford the cost.
attributes.additional_details: The average cost of seeing a Dental Hygienist is now £59. A 6 monthly check up is over £30 and if work needs doing, it can be hundreds of pounds.

attributes.action: Ban the use of full names in GP or hospital waiting rooms
attributes.background: Confidentiality is up most important in settings such as GP surgeries and hospitals. Data protection laws are tougher now than ever. However they don’t seem to apply when in a waiting room, the professional will call you through by using your full name in front of other people.
attributes.additional_details: I am starting this petition after a prisoner attached to their guard in a waiting room was called through for his appointment. All it took was for me to google their name and gather information as to why they were in prison, how long their sentence was and their address. People’s identities should be protected in GP and hospital waiting rooms.

attributes.action: Ban night shift working, for the sake of the health of workers
attributes.background: Studies have established that the health of workers in the UK is directly negatively affected by night shift working. I ask Parliament to hold a debate over this practice. Why are hard-working people being made to suffer unnecessarily, and why does the Health and Safety at Work Act not protect them?
attributes.additional_details: Long-term night shift work is associated with an increased risk of certain cancers, as well as metabolic problems, heart disease, ulcers and gastrointestinal problems. People who work night shifts or rotating shifts often don't sleep enough. Long-term sleep deprivation is known to be bad for health. Statistics show that a large amount of UK workers are shift workers and, in particular, night shift workers.

attributes.action: Dual the entire route of the A47
attributes.background: Tens of thousands of vehicles use the A47 every year. It is one of the most important roads in the UK more specifically the East of England. The route is also used by numerous logistics companies. However there are also hundreds of accidents every   causing confusion and delay.

attributes.action: Stop Cat D (open prisons) holding sex offenders within 5 miles of any school.
attributes.background: Safety for all our children. An open prison means prisoners can leave prison unescorted. Being near any school I feel this is asking for trouble and very dangerous.

attributes.action: Outlaw councils from banning dogs from public beaches in England and Wales.
attributes.background: Most dog owners pick up their dog waste and control their  dogs. People work all week or all even year for those magic moments on a beach with their family and dog, only to find dogs are not allowed on many beaches in England and Wales.
attributes.additional_details: More litter/dog wardens could be employed giving offenders high on the spot fines.

attributes.action: Exempt all childcare for children and young people with disabilities
attributes.background: Parents and carers are required to pay VAT 20% on top of their childcare, which puts families in financial difficulties. This will reflect negatively on the family and child’s welfare.
attributes.additional_details: Child care for children and young people should be counted as a Disability service and be made Tax-Free.
